loans.name: Kibosho Group

texts.en:
Lucy, who is in her early thirties, is married and has three sons who are in school. Since 2010, Lucy has been running a shop selling cosmetics. She opens her business from 08am to 08pm per working day and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

Lucy took some previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania but later she stopped. She is now coming back to request a new loan which she will use to buy different types of cosmetics to sell. With her previous loans, all of which she has paid back successfully, she managed to buy a freezer so that she can sell cold soft drinks. She also purchased more cosmetics which sold. Lucy plowed her profits back into her business. 

In the coming years, Lucy would like to restock her shop with more cosmetics. She will share this loan with her loan group "KIBOSHO" which totals 8 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Zingatia Group

texts.en:
Sakina, who is in her mid-40s, is married and has a boy and girl who are in school. For a period of four years now, she has been managing her family by running a shop selling soft drinks like water, sodas and juices. She also sells cooking oil in the same shop. Sakina runs her business from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania and she will use the loan to buy new shop stocks to resell. With her previous loans, all of which she repaid successfully, she bought sold-out business stocks. She reinvested the business profits she earned in her business. Sakina dreams of expanding her business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group Zingatia, which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new stock to resell.

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Filbert, who is in his mid-forties, is married and has a son and a daughter. One of his kids is in school while the other is still young. Filbert is a businessman who devotes his time to different businesses. He runs a pharmacy, a food shop and a stored-card money-transfer business (M-pesa, Tigo pesa and Airtel). He employs a few helpers who run all sales. Last year, Filbert was in school studying for a certificate and has now graduated. He has been in these businesses for ten years now. Filbert's businesses are open from 7am to 10pm, and he is able to make a very good profit.

This is Filbert's ninth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use the loan to increase in his M-pesa, Tigo Pesa and Airtel money vaults to serve more people. He used his previous loans, which he paid back successfully, to open two of his current businesses: money transfers and pharmacy. Filbert earned a profit, which he used to pay school fees for his child and his own tuition fees. Filbert also covered household expenses and saved. His dream is to build a nice family house.

Filbert will share this loan with his loan group, Wazo Tegeta, which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase in his M-pesa, Tigo Pesa and Airtel (money transfer) vaults to serve more people.

loans.name: Nguvu Moja Group

texts.en:
Rahma, who is in her mid-thirties, is married and has three children, who are still going to school. She has been running a genge-duka (grocery store) for eight years now. She works from 4am to 8.30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rahma's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to expand the genge-duka and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is grateful for the loans. She used the profit to pay for school fees and household expenses. She will use this loan to buy fruits, vegetables, rice, sugar, beans, salt, maize flour, baking flour and cooking oil. She dreams of being able to put electricity in her new house.

Rahma will share this loan with her group, Nguvu Moja, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, rice, sugar, beans, salt, maize flour, baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a  fridge for her business and drinks.

loans.name: Twitange Group

texts.en:
Neema is single woman in her early thirties. She has been running a genge business, selling fruits and vegetables for three years. Neema has two girls who are in school. She operates her business from 08am to 08pm per working day and is able to make a small profit per month. 

This is Neema's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy genge stocks. With the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, she bought business stock. Neema used the business profit to cover school fees and household expenses. She has a habit of saving for her future.  She dreams of expanding her genge business to a big genge, selling more items. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" Twitange" which totals 05 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy genge stocks

loans.name: Rufiji Group

texts.en:
Zaituni, who is in her early 40s, is married with six children and only three of them are still at school. She has been running a business of fruits and vegetables for one year now. She works from 8am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Zaituni's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the quantity of fruits and vegetable and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetable in oder to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of building her own house.

Zaituni will share this loan with her loan group "RUFIJI" with eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetable in oder to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Muungano - Beach Group

texts.en:
Leah, who is in her early thirties, is single with one child who is still in school. She has been a food vendor for ten years now. She works from 11am to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Leah's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her food stock. She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She is doing fine. She will use this loan to restock missing items in her food stall. She dreams of building her own house.

Leah will share this loan with her loan group Muungano - Beach, which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to restock missing items in her food stall.

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
Fadhili is in his early 30s. He has a wife and together they are blessed with a baby girl. Fadhili is currently running a shop selling cell phone accessories. He has been in this enterprise for one year and six months. He is known for being a hardworking man. Fadhili starts his job from 08am to 09pm and is able to make a good monthly profit.

He is requesting a first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he will use to buy new types and sold out cell phone accessories. Fadhili dreams that one day he will be able to own a big shop selling accessories for cell phones. 

Fadhili will share this loan with his loan group" MPUNGA" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new types and sold out cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Lusuvilo Group

texts.en:
Maulid, who is in his mid-thirties, is married and has got one girl who is still in school. For three years now, Mr. Maulid makes his family living by running a genge business, as it is commonly known in Tanzania. This is a business selling fruits and vegetables which normally need to be replaced with new products every few days to add to the old ones. He wakes up at 7am for the business and stops at 9pm. Maulid is able to make a fair monthly profit.

Maulid is requesting for his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, to buy fruits and vegetables. Maulid managed to receive a profit and used it to cover school fees and home food expenses. He will use this loan to buy genge stocks to attract people. He dreams that one day he will be able to open another genge in another place. 

He will share this loan with his loan group “LUSUVILO” which totals four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of genge (fruits and vegetables) to attract people.

loans.name: Tupendane C Group

texts.en:
Emanuel, who is in his mid-30s, is a married father of two young children. One of his kids is in school. He has been selling a variety of foods and drinks such as sodas, juice, water, chips, fried chicken, miskaki and eggs for 10 years now. He has a second similar shop run by an employee, although Emanuel still monitors and supervises the shop. Working from 10:00 am till after midnight he is able to make a very good profit per month.

This will be Emanuel's 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans, all since repaid, to purchase a motorcycle, a fridge and inventory for his food businesses. He used his profits to buy a radio, a sofa set, and a plot of land, and has built a small house at his village place. He will use this loan to buy Irish potatoes and drinks, including sodas, juice and water to resell. Emanuel dreams of owning a wholesale shop and is so happy with the loans which have allowed him to improve his life. 

Emanuel will share this loan with his loan group "Tupendane C" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes and drinks, including sodas, juice and water to resell.

loans.name: Kisukulu Group

texts.en:
FRANCIS, who is in his late 20s, is single. He has been selling cold drinks since 2008. He works from 07am to 09pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be FRANCIS's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on the cold drinks and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is doing great!  He appreciates everyone who has supported their group. He used the profit to pay rent, electricity bills and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy new drinks. He dreams of building his own house.

FRANCIS will share this loan with his loan group "KISUKULU" with four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to order new clothes for her business.

loans.name: Star Group

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman aged in her early fifties. She has got five children, two sons and three daughters; three of them are in school. For two years now, Mary has devoted her life time to business issues. She runs two businesses. One is as a food supplier where she supplies crepes and baobab seeds which she makes her self. She supplies these food to Zanzibar. Mary also manages a chips and fried chicken business. She starts her business at 9am and it is open to midnight hours. She is able to make an excellent monthly profit. 

Mary is requesting her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy stocks of food for her businesses. Mary is a hardworking woman and is a person who is successfully ambitious. In the coming years, she would like to be a successful and famous woman. She will share this loan with her loan group "STAR" which totals five people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of food for her business.

loans.name: Mwaminifu Group

texts.en:
Scola, in her mid-forties, is a married woman who has got four children, two boys and two girls. All of them are in school. For three years now, she has been making her living by running a hardware shop selling cement, iron sheets, wire, pipes and other building materials. Before starting her current business, Scola was running a poultry business. She switched from the former business after she moved to her new living place. Her new living place is full of construction activity, so the hardware business is more sought after by people. She opens her business at 6:30 am and goes till 6:00 pm and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her sixth-plus loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, to pay business helpers, restock hardware items and build a chicken-shed. Scola managed to receive a profit and she used it to cover house building expenses, school fees and household expenses. She will use this loan to pay business rent. She dreams of taking out a loan for herself to restart her poultry business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mwaminifu" which consists of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay business rent.

loans.name: Maarifa Group

texts.en:
Grace, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who are still going to school. She has been running a clothing business for three years now. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Grace's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy different types of clothes and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses. She is happy with the loan. She will use this loan to buy clothes to sell to more customers. She dreams of owning a taxi which would bring her a daily income.

Grace will share this loan with her loan group "Maarifa" with four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell to more customers.

loans.name: Tumaini Musoma Group

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman aged early thirties and she has three children who are in school. For three years now, Mary has been managing a shop selling cell phones and phone accessories. She opens her business at 7 am and works till 6 pm each work day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is Mary's second loan request with Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan which she paid back in full to buy business phones and accessories. She managed to earn a profit and she used it to buy a business house and cover school fees and food expenses. Mary dreams that in the coming years she will be able to stop taking loans after strengthening her business and proceed with her shop. She will use this loan to buy more cell phone accessories to stock and sell.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group "TUMAINI" which totals three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories to stock for her business.

loans.name: Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Emanuel, who is in his early thirties, is married. Emanuel makes his living by devoting his time to business. He is currently running a business selling radios, DVD decks, TVs,  and other electrical items. He has been in this business for five years now. Emanuel opens his business from 7 AM to 9 PM daily  and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is Emanuel's twelfth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, to buy business radios, TVs, etc. He managed to sell his previous business stocks even though some of it still remains. The business profit that he earned, he used to build a house, buy a sofa set, and cover school fees. He will use this loan to buy new business radios and other electronics equipments.  In the coming days, Emanuel would like to be a successfully businessman. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, Pamoja, which consists of five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new business radios and other electronics equipments.

loans.name: Utukufu Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a single woman with four children (two boys and two girls). All of her children are in school. For two years now, Joyce has been making her living by running a cafe selling soft drinks, food and bites. Joyce learned this business from her sister and father who are also doing a cafe business. She runs her cafe business from 5 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is Joyce's first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use the loan to buy a variety of ingredients to cook more types of food. She dreams of owning a hotel (restaurant) in the coming days. Joyce will share this loan with her loan group Utukufu, which includes five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ingredients to cook more food.

loans.name: Mt Ulunguru Group

texts.en:
Sabina, who is in her early 30s, is single. She has been running a pub for two years now. She works from 4:00 pm to after midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sabina's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a fridge for selling cold drinks and to buy cold drinks, beers, wine and spirits. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the drinks in her store. She dreams of building her own house.

Sabina will share her loan with her loan group, Mt Ulunguru, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the drinks in the store.

loans.name: Mtambani Group

texts.en:
Magdalena, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children who are still at school. She has been a tailor since 2007. She works from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Magdalena's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying materials to make more suits and dresses. She dreams of buying an overlocking machine.

Magdalena will share this loan with her loan group "Mtambani," which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials to make more suits and dresses.

loans.name: Mbinga Group

texts.en:
Salome, who is in her late 30s, is single with three children who are still going to school. She has been a food vendor for six years now.  She works from 11 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Salome's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase her food stock and has paid back her loan successfully.  She is grateful for the loan.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy rice, maize flour, baking flour, beans, cooking oil and charcoal. She dreams of building her own house.

Salome will share this loan with her loan group "Mbinga," which has 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize flour, baking flour, beans, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Juu Kwa Juu Group

texts.en:
Hamisi, who is in his early 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school. He has been running a genge-duka (small grocery stall) business for five years now. He works from 7am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Hamisi's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to restock the missing items in his genge-duka and has paid back his loan successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy rice, cooking oil, maize flour, baking flour, beans, fruits and vegetables to meet his customers' demand. He dreams of increasing his business into a very big shop.

Hamisi will share this loan with his loan group "Juu Kwa Juu" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, maize flour, baking flour, beans, fruits and vegetables to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Dubai Group

texts.en:
George, who is in his late 40s, is married with seven children who are still at school. He has been engaged in two businesses, a motorcycle transport business and selling fruits and vegetables. He has been in these businesses for three years now.  He works from 6 am to 6.30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be George's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start selling fruits and vegetables and bought fuel for the motorcycle. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit from his businesses to pay for school fees and cover household expenses. He is doing fine with his loan. He will use this loan to service the motorcycle and to buy fruits and vegetables to resell.  He dreams of buying another motorcycle.

George will share this loan with his loan group "DUBAI" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to service the motorcycle and to buy fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Lindi Group

texts.en:
Raphia, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school. She has been a food vendor for four years. She works from 10:00am to 5:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Raphia's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to stock missing items in the food store and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is grateful for the loan and appreciates everyone who has supported their group. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy more bags of rice, maize flour, baking flour, beans and cooking oil to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of building her own house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "LINDI," with three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy  more bags of rice, maize flour, baking flour, beans and cooking oil to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Crane Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her late 20s, is married and has two children who are in school. Since 2006, Amina has been making her living by running two small businesses. She owns a genge business selling fruits and vegetables, and she also cooks bites like chapati and half cake with fresh juice. This business enables her to increase her income. Amina starts her business at 7:00 am and closes at 9:00 pm daily. She is able to make a small profit each month.
Amina is requesting a fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables and new clothes to resell. With her previous four loans, which she repaid in full, she was able to service her business with new food ingredients and fruits and vegetables. Amina thanks Kiva lenders for their support in improving her business. She managed to earn a profit which she used to cover school and household expenses. She dreams that one day, she will be able to expand her business to other areas and to increase her income. 
Amina will share this loan with her loan group CRANE, which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables and new clothes to resell.

loans.name: Comoro Group

texts.en:
Tatu, who is in her early 20s, is single with two children, a boy and a girl who are still at school.  She has been selling fruits and vegetables for seven years now. She works from 5 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Tatu's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for opening a retail shop.  She dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman.

Tatu will share this loan with her loan group "COMORO" which has a total of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a retail shop.

loans.name: Kahangara Group

texts.en:
Joseph, who is in his early 30s, is married with one child who is still small. He has been a carpenter for fourteen years now and is able to make a fair monthly profit. He works from 6am to 6pm daily.

This will be Joseph's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy different types of wood for making different types of furniture. He has paid back his loans successfully. He used the profit to covered household expenses and saved some in the bank. He will use this loan to buy a good stock of wood in order to make more furniture. He dreams of building a good house.

Joseph will share this loan with his loan group "Kahangara" with two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a good stock of wood in order to make more furniture.

loans.name: Mt Elgon Group

texts.en:
Getruda sells women's clothes and jewelry to earn her living. She sells such items as women's underwear, dresses, blouses, necklaces, and a variety of handbags. Getruda has been in this business for five years. She works from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. each work day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

Getruda is in her early thirties. She and her husband have a son who is in school.

Getruda is requesting her thirteenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She has repaid all of her previous loans successfully. Getruda used these previous loans to restock high-demand products like handbags. With the business profit she received, she was able to pay her child's school fees and cover household expenses. 

With her new loan funds, she will replenish her business inventory of women's clothing and jewelry items. She dreams of eventually opening a shop where she can display and sell her products. 
 
Getruda will share this loan with her loan group "Mt Elgon," which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: replenish her business inventory of women's clothing and jewelry items

loans.name: Tarangire Group

texts.en:
Zuwena, who is in her early 40s, is a single woman who has six children, one son and five daughters. Zuwena's children are in school. For two years now, she makes her living by running a retail shop selling airtime, matchboxes, dry food items and other quick moving items.  Zuwena also sells clothes on credit. She runs her business from 6 am to to 11 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, to buy clothes and stock sold at her shop. Zuwena managed to receive a profit which she used to cover school fees and home food expenses. She is now requesting another loan which she will use to buy stock of clothes and replace sold out products in her shop. She dreams that one day she will be able to open another enterprise. 

Zuwena will share this loan with her loan group, Tarangire, which consist of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes and sold out products in her shop.

loans.name: Songa Mbele Group

texts.en:
Said, who is a man in his early forties, is married and has three boys and one girl who are in school. Said has been running a genge-duka, a business commonly known for selling fruits, vegetables, dry foods, soaps, sweets, and other simple goods. He has been in this business since 2006. Said opens his shop at 6:00am and is open until 8:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Said is requesting a new loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He has been a Tujijenge customer since 2007 and Said managed to pay back his previous loans successfully. He used them to restock his genge-duka with new fruit and vegetable items and opened a new business of charging cell phones. Said earned a profit which he used to buy a plot of land and build a house; he also paid school fees and purchased food for his family. He will use this new loan to buy new fruits and vegetables and replace sold out items in his business. Said dreams to open a wholesale shop.
 
He will share this loan with his loan group "Songa Mbele" which has four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new fruits and vegetables and other items for his business.

loans.name: Tukundane Group

texts.en:
Evaline is in her late thirties and is a mother of two daughters who are in school. For a period of six years now, Evaline has made a living by running a business selling freshwater fish. She opens her business from 7:00am to 6:00pm per working day and is able to make a very good profit. 

This is Evaline's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Evaline managed to pay back all of her previous loans successfully. She used the previous loans to restock her fish for resale. She earned a profit and she used it to cover a portion of school fees and household expenses. With her new request, she will use the loan to buy stock of fish to resell. Evaline dreams that one day she will be able to build a nice house and buy a car.
 
She wills share this loan with her loan group, "TUKUNDANE", which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish to resell.

loans.name: Twaweza Mwanza Group

texts.en:
Ngwashi is in her mid-40's, married and the mother of six children, all of whom attend school. For the last 12 years, she has made her living by selling fabrics. She opens her business from 10:00 am to 05:00 pm daily and is able to make a small profit each month. 

This will be her third loan request, which she will use to buy fabrics to increase her sales.  With the previous loans, each of which was paid back successfully, she bought clothing, all of which she sold. Ngwashi managed her business well and earned a good profit. She used the profit to build a small house, pay some family expenses and save for the future. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a big house. 

She will share this loan with her group, Twaweza, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to increase her sales.

loans.name: Vestline Group

texts.en:
Obedi, who is in his late thirties, is married with four children who are in school. He has been supporting his family by running a cafe and a cigarette business. He sells cigarettes wholesale. He has been in these businesses for seven years. Obedi runs his business from 6:00am to 11:00pm every day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is Obedi's sixth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, to build a place of packing cars and buy a bicycle for his cigarette business. Obedi managed to earn a profit which he used to cover building expenses, school fees, household expenses and savings for his future. He dreams that one day he will be able to own a stable and successful business. He will use this loan to buy a motorbike for his cigarette business.

He will share this loan with his loan group "VESTLINE" which includes three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his cigarette business.

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.en:
Alex is a member of Baraka group, the group which is known for working hard and being successfully ambitious. He joined this group to be able to get loans for his business improvement. Alex who is married, is in his late 20s and has got a son who is still young. For two months now, Alex has been involved with a butcher business selling meat. Before he was employed but he decided to run his own business.  He starts working from 06am to 08pm daily and is able to make a very good profit per month. 

Alex is requesting a first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy meat for his new butcher shop which he is going to open soon. In the coming years, Alex would like to be a successful man with a good businesses. He will share this loan with his loan group" BARAKA" which consists of five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy meat for his new butcher shop which he is going to open soon

loans.name: Munduli B Group

texts.en:
Hadija is in her mid thirties and has two boys and two girls, all of them in school. Hadija is single and she makes her family living by running a mamalishe (cafe) business. She is working hard to assure her children's basic needs are covered, like school fees and healthcare. She has been in this business for a period of five years. Hadija wakes up very early in the morning (5am) daily and her business ends at 4pm. With the time she works, she is able to earn a small monthly profit. 

Hadija's family depends on her current business. Hadija does not have an extra source of income. So, she has been looking for a way to improve her business so as to raise an extra income. Hadija is requesting a fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy cooking supplies like maize and baking flour, some kilos of beans, sugar, tomatoes, onions, and Irish potatoes which she used for source making.  Hadija has successfully paid back all loans. She used the small profit to pay school fees and buy food for her family. She will use this loan to buy stock of food ingredients for her food business. Hadija dreams that one day she will be able to build a house for her family. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "MUNDULI B" which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of food ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Kilombero Group

texts.en:
Obasanjo, who is in his late 30s, is married with three children. Two of his children are in school and one is still small.  He has had a public transportation business for 10 years now.  He works from 6:30 am until 9 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Obasanjo's 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to maintain his dala dala (minibus share taxis)  and has paid back all of his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, build one room to rent and cover his household expenses.  He will use his loan to repair the engine of the dala dala,  He dreams of owing a big business.

Obasanjo will share this loan with his group "Kilombero", which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to repair the engine of his dala dala

loans.name: Tembo A Group

texts.en:
Amosi is a married man in his late thirties with two girls who are in school.  He has spend the last four years selling dagaa, maize, beans, rice and other dry food. His business operates from 7:30am to 6:00pm daily and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania and he wishes to buy sacks of dagaa (a small dry fish). He dreams that one day he will be able to buy more stocks of dagaa and sell in other counties. 

He will share this loan with his loan group " TEMBO A" which has four members. The members of the group hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of dagaa which is a small dry fish.

loans.name: Nzasa Group

texts.en:
Nasra, who is in her early 20s, is married with two children, one of whom goes to school; the other one is still small. She has been running a beauty salon since 2005.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Nasra's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use the loan for buying salon equipment. She dreams of selling fabrics and Muslim-type clothes (madila).

Nasra will share this loan with her loan group, "Nzasa", which has eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Hekima Group Musoma

texts.en:
SONG'ORA, who is in his early 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school. He has been having two projects: selling fish and operating a motorcycle transportation business. He has been in his business for five years now. He works from 7 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be SONG'ORA's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start selling fish and to service his motorcycle so that it will be in  good condition to make more trips. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He used his profit to pay school fees, to build his house, and to cover household expenses. 

He will use this loan to buy another motorcycle for his transportation business. He dreams of building a house for renting.

SONG'ORA will share this loan with his loan group "HEKIMA GROUP MUSOMA" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Faraja  Group

texts.en:
Philiphilina, who is in her late thirties, is married and has four children of her own as well as five other dependents. All of the children are in school. For four years now, Philiphilina has been managing a business selling charcoal wholesale. She operates her business from 7:00am to 6:00pm per working day and is able to make a very small profit per month. 
This will be her fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy sacks of charcoal. Philiphilina has paid back all her loans successfully. She managed to earn a profit, which she used to cover school fees and part of her household expenses. With the new loan, Philiphilina will start selling dagaa, a kind of small fish. She needs to expand her portfolio so as to raise extra income for her family. She dreams that one day she will be able to build extra rooms for her family and own a wholesale shop. 
Philiphilina will share this loan with her loan group, FARAJA which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling dagaa, a kind of small fish.

loans.name: Kisemvure Group

texts.en:
Kibaya, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children; one of them goes to school and the other one is still small. She has been running two projects: a beauty salon and selling clothes. She has been in her business for three years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Kibaya's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy salon equipment and to expand the clothing shop. She dreams of owning a car.

Kibaya will share this loan with her loan group "Kisemvure", which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment and to expand a clothing shop.

loans.name: Sarafina Group

texts.en:
Safina is hard working woman who makes her living by running a food stall business (mamalishe). She decided to run this business because she lacks higher education, which would enable her to be employed in a better place. Safina is a single woman in her late twenties. She has two children who are in school. The mamalishe business enables Safina to generate an extra income to meet her daily family needs. She wakes up early in the morning and works up to 07:30 pm daily. Safina is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is Safina's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy food ingredients for her mamalishe business, like rice, cooking oil, flours and others. With the previous loans all of which were repaid successfully, she used to buy a motorbike for transportation and food cooking supplies. She used the profits to pay for school fees and home expenses. Safina dreams that one day she will be able to buy a plot of land.

She will share this loan with her loan group" SARAFINA", which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her food stall (mamalishe) business, like rice, cooking oil, flour and others.

loans.name: Ufunuo Group

texts.en:
Anita is a single woman in her early thirties. She has a daughter in school. For five years now she has been managing her family by running a clothes business. She sells these clothes by putting them on the ground on the street and sells to passers-by.  She runs her business from 02:00 pm to 07:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 
This will be her 13th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock clothes for sale. Anita managed to repay all of her previous loans successfully. She earned a profit which she used to cover her house expenses, and bought a fridge, mattress, radio, cupboard and dressing table. With the new request she will use the funds to buy new stock for selling. In the coming years, she would like to manage a shop so as to avoid ground sale disturbances. 
She will share this loan with her loan group" UFUNUO' which totals two members. The members will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy new stocks tio sell.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en: RENATUS, who is in his early 40s is married with three sons who are still at school.  He has been selling clothes for four years now.  He works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

loans.use: to buy better quality and different types of clothes.

loans.name: Ununio Group

texts.en:
Lameck is a married man and has got four children who are in school. He is in his mid thirties. Currently, he runs a genge (fruits and vegetables) and food stall business. Lameck is in these businesses for five years now and he opens from 06:00am to 09:00pm daily and is able to make a fair profit.

This will be Lameck's second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to repair his food stall place by making it stand strong and bought stocks of food. He managed to pay back his entire entire loan successfully. Lameck received a profit which he used to cover school fees and food expenses for his family. With the new loan request Lameck will use the money to buy used stocks for his business store. He dreams that one day he will be able to own a big shop. 

He will share this loan with his loan group"UNUNIO" which totals seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stocks for his business store.

loans.name: Coka - Kiwalani Group

texts.en:
Stephano, who is his early 30s is married with two children. One of his children is in school and the other one is still young. Stephano has been selling materials, like cement, bricks and sand, and has had a motorcycle for two years now. He works from 7 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Stephano's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a motorcycle, cement and bricks and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy cement, bricks and sand for his hardware business. He dreams of opening another hardware shop in a different area.

Stephano will share this loan with his loan group, "Coka - Kiwalani," which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and sand for his construction business.

loans.name: Mkudi Group

texts.en:
Elesi, who is in her early thirties, is married and has got a boy and girl who are in school. For thirteen years now Elesi has been running a business selling clothes, juice and small fish, dagaa. She runs her business from 08am to 06pm per working day and is able to make a small monthly profit.

Elesi is requesting a new loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy business clothes to resell. In the coming days Elesi dreams of becoming a big clothes designer. She will share this loan with her loan group" MKUDI" which consist of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business clothes to resell.

loans.name: Kilimanjaro Group

texts.en:
Muhiga  is in his late 20s and single. Muhiga has  a young daughter. 

For two years, he has managed his life by running a clothing and shoe business. His business is opened from 9am to 10pm and he is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is Muhiga’s first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania.  It will be used to buy new clothes and shoes. He dreams of becoming a successfull businessman.  

He will share this loan with his loan group ” KILIMANJARO” which consist of five people who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy the newest fashions clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Wachapakazi Group

texts.en:
Almac, who is in his mid-thirties, is single with four children who are still in school.  He has been running a cosmetics business for seven years now.  He works from 7 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Almac's twelfth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his cosmetics stock and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  He is doing great and appreciates everyone who has supported his group.  He will use this loan to buy more and different kinds of cosmetics to meet his customers' demand.  He dreams of becoming a big business man.

Almac will share this loan with his loan group, Wachapakazi, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more and different kinds of cosmetics

loans.name: Sheraton Group

texts.en:
Pili, who is in her late 20s, is single, with one son who is at school.  She has been running a grocery store for four months.  She works from 5pm to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Pili's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to sell clothes and food, and now she is running a grocery store.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy beers, sodas, spirits, juice, wine and water for the grocery.  She dreams of making her business big.

Pili will share this loan with her loan group "Sheraton," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas, spirits, juice, wine and water for the grocery store.

loans.name: Mchicha Group

texts.en:
RAMADHANI, who is in his mid 30's, is married and has two children, one of whom goes to school.  The other one is still small.  He has been selling kerosene for three years now.  He works from 8am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be RAMADHANI's 3rd loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy kerosene, and managed to supply to many customers.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He is doing fine with his loan and appreciates all who have supported their group.  He used the profit to pay school fees and bought a TV dish and TV table, and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to start selling cooking oil called alizeti. He dreams of buying land.  

RAMADHANI will share this loan with his loan group "Mchicha" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling cooking oil, called alizeti.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Top Class Group

texts.en:
Janeth is in her mid thirties and is single with two children who are still at school. She has been selling cold drinks for four years now. She works from 7 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Janeth's seventh loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of drinks and has paid back her loans successfully. She is doing fine and appreciates everyone who has supported her group. She used the profit to pay her children's school fees, cover household expenses and save money in the bank. She will use this loan to buy a good stock of soft drinks to meet customer demand. She dreams of building her own house.

Janeth will share this loan with her loan group "TOP CLASS", which has eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a good stock of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Dolphin Group

texts.en:
Mosi, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children, two of whom go to school and one who is still small.  She has been a food vendor for eight years now.  She works from 5 a.m. to 1 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mosi's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the stock whenever she got a new loan. Her business has grown and can now serve many people. She appreciates everyone who has supported their group.  She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy rice, maize flour, cooking oil, beans, baking flour, sugar and charcoal.   She dreams of owning a bajaji (tricycle). Mosi will share this loan with her loan group "Dolphin", which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize flour, cooking oil, beans, baking flour, sugar and charcoal

loans.name: Waaminifu Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her mid-twenties, is married and has children who are in school. For three years, Mariam has had a shop selling different items like soaps, airtime, maize flour, sodas, and juices. Her shop is open from 8am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

Mariam is requesting her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to add stock to her shop, and all were paid back successfully. Mariam is doing well and thanks those who have supported her group. She used her business profits to meet her family's needs, like food and health care. 

Mariam will use this loan to buy new stock for her shop. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a nice family house. Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "WAAMINIFU," which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new stock for her shop.

loans.name: Weke Buke Group

texts.en:
Night is a businesswoman who manages her living by running two businesses. She manages a shop selling dry foods, vouchers, match boxes and other things. She also owns a food stall where she provides food services. She has been in these businesses for ten years now and she starts from 6am to 9pm daily. Night is in her early thirties and has got three kids who are in school. She is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the loans to buy stock for her shop like rice, maize flour, baking flour, sugar, salt, etc. She has paid back all of her loans successfully. With the profit she earned, Night paid school fees and home food expenses. Night saved part of her business profit. She will use this new loan to buy stock for her retail shop and food ingredients for her food stall. She dreams of improving her family's life with a nice house and providing her kids with a better education.

Night will share this loan with her loan group "Weke Buke" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for her retail shop and food ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Mafinga Group

texts.en:
Bupe is in her early thirties and is single with two children who are in school.  She has been conducting international business, where she buys clothes and cell phones from neighboring countries and sells them in Tanzania. She sells her stocks wholesale and she is in this activity since 2010. If she has stocks she sells from 08 am to 06:30 pm and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy new stocks to sell to more customers. Bupe has successfully repaid her loans. She managed to generate a profit, which she used to pay home rent, school fees and her own home expenses. She dreams that in the coming days she will be able to improve her life. 
Bupe will share this loan with her loan group "MAFINGA " which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new stocks to sell to more customers.

loans.name: Minazini Group

texts.en:
Regina, who is in her early forties, is married with two children who are still at school. She has been running a fruit and vegetable business since 1999.  She works from 5am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Regina's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the stock of fruit and vegetables and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, buy a plot of land and cover household expenses. She is happy with the loan. She will use this loan to restock the missing items in the fruit and vegetable stock.  She dreams of building her own house. 

Regina will share this loan with her loan group "MINAZINI," which has thee members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock missing items in the fruit and vegetable stock.

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
Teddy, who is in her early 20s, is single. She has been a food-vendor for three years. She works from 5:00am to 4.30pm daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Teddy's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy rice, sugar, beans, peas, maize flour, baking flour, cooking oil, and charcoal. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Teddy will share this loan with her loan group, Mpunga Group, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy  rice, sugar, beans, peas, maize flour, baking flour, cooking oil, and charcoal.

loans.name: Temboni Group

texts.en:
Lucy, who is in her early forties, is married with three children who are still in school.  She has been running a retail business since 2003.  She works from 6 am to 9.30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Lucy's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock missing items in her shop.  She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a deep freezer, a TV table and covered household expenses.  She is doing great with her loans and appreciates every one who has supported their group.  She will use this loan to restock missing inventory in her shop.  She dreams of buying a Suzuki car.

Lucy will share this loan with her loan group Temboni, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock missing inventory in her shop.

loans.name: Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Felician, who is in her early 60s, is a widow with five children who are grown-ups. She has been running a poultry business since 2002. She works from 5 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Felician's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy different types of chicken. She started with cock and then moved to layers (these are for laying eggs). This is her business now.  She has repaid all her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay for school fees for her children. By then, they were still at school. She also used the other portion of the profit to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy chicks and chicken feeds. She dreams of building her own house.

Felician will share this loan with her loan group "Nia Njema," which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is a farmer and a resident of Kisii. She has two children. She has been a farmer for five years, producing and selling milk and eggs. In farming, she enjoys tending and feeding her livestock. Her biggest challenges are livestock diseases.

Milkah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan as they will give her a dairy loan and their loans have low interest rates. During the training given, she learned how to do agriculture commercially. She said that this loan will give her family more milk and the income from the sale of milk will improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer living in Eldoret where he has been farming for 12 years. He is married and has 3 children, both of whom are of school going age. In his farm he produces and sells milk, vegetables, and maize, which he enjoys very much, but he experiences a challenge in the lack of adequate finances for carrying out his farming activities.
Joseph chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because he wants to construct a dairy unit for his dairy cows,and because they are interested with the welfare of small scale farmers. During the training he learnt a lot about group work and that unity is key for growth in business. With the loan,Moses will buy animal feed for his cattle. This will cause his income to increase due to increased production.

loans.use: construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida lives in Kisii, a banana and sugar cane growing area. She is married and has three children and has been farming for six years; she produces and sells milk.

Leonida chose Juhudi Kilimo for funding her because they have affordable interest rates on their loans, and the loan officers offer training to clients on asset finances so that they can choose assets that will bring better returns to them. During the training, she learned how to develop a savings culture.

Leonida says that with the income generated from this loan, she will be able to purchase poultry that will increase her income base and thus improve her family's living standards and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to start a poultry project.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas resides in Kitale and has been farming for 3 years.  He produces and sells milk, eggs, and maize.  He really enjoys dairy and poultry farming, but his greatest challenge is animal disease.

Silas requests a second loan with Juhudi Kilimo because the first loan enabled him to buy poultry. That loan helped him economically and he still wants to enlarge his poultry farm. He is pleased that the Juhudi loans are on a short-term basis.  

Silas said that since he doesn't have a family of his own, the income from the poultry will help him to educate his brothers and sisters.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas lives in Kisii, a prime area for the growth of bananas and production of sugar cane.He is married and has three children, all of whom are of school-going age. He has been doing farming for the past ten years. He produces and sells milk, tea and eggs.
Farming is his major source of income, and therefore he puts a lot of effort and resources into it. His major challenge in farming is poor infrastructure and lack of proper markets.
Thomas chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they meet the needs of small-scale farmers, and the interest rate on their loans is low. The income generated from this loan will enable him to cater to his children's school fees and also improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas lives in the Chuka area of eastern Kenya. She is married and has three children, all of school-going age. 

She has been doing farming for seven years, and her main source of income is from maize, eggs, milk, and vegetables. Farming is enjoyable to her because it is a source of income, and her family can eat well because of the farm produce. Her greatest challenge in these loans is a lack of market for her produce.

Dorcas chose Juhudi Kilimo because she wants to improve her farming. During the training offered by B.D.O.s, she learnt that microfinance institutions do help small-scale farmers to improve on their livelihoods. 

This loan will enable her to get more income through selling pork in the market, and thus be able to provide better education for her children. It will also improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is  a farmer who lives in Kitale area of Northrift Kenya with his wife and 3 school-aged children.

He has farmed for 2 years and produces and sells eggs and  maize.  He enjoys farming because it gives him income to take care of the needs of his family.

Boaz chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because he heard that they help small-scale farmers to grow their business  and become successful.  He learned about the insurance policy given for dairy cows and he loved the idea very much.  

This loan will greatly benefit  his family because it will bring in more income through the sale of milk.   The income will help meet his family's needs and children's school fees.

loans.use: to  purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in Kitale region of North rift, an area where there there is a high production and consumption of maize. He is married and has 6 children and has practiced farming for 16 years where he produces and sells eggs, maize, and sugarcane. He also has a posho mill which serves the locals by grinding maize for them, this acts as an extra source of income.
Simon chose Juhudi Kilimo because it will help him to purchase a dairy cow so that he can begin selling milk. During the training he received from the loan officers,he learned that mfi's offer their loans at a lower interest rates and they also assist low income farmers to acquire finances that will help them increase their income. He wants to grow in agri-business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a  mother of four children, all of school-going age, and they live in Kitale. She has been doing farming for two years, where she produces and sells mostly eggs, milk, and some few crops.What she loves most about farming is feeding the dairy cows so that they can produce more milk.The major challenge she faces is cleaning the dairy shed and seasons of drought which hit her very hard because of less production.

Leah chose Juhudi Kilimo because it helps small-scale farmers to grow economically by offering them loans for assets in the farm and gives them training because of offering them loans, and also because it has flexible loan repayment terms.Through the income from this loan, Leah will be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: purchase poultry.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas resides in Kitale with his wife and 6 children. He has practiced farming for 9 years where like most farmers in Kitale, he produces and sells milk, eggs, maize, sunflower, and beans.He enjoys farming because of the income he gets out of it which is able to sustain him and his family.
Thomas chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because Juhudi uplifts the livelihoods of small scale farmers, he is also able to acquire capital for his farm at an affordable interest rate.This loan will help him acquire a dairy cow and thus increase milk production for his family consumption and also selling which will bring in more money that will help to cater for his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a farmer living in Kitale with her husband and 5 children, all of whom are of school-going age.

She has been doing agriculture for 8 years and she produces and sells milk, maize and vegetables. She enjoys farming because it has helped sustain her family. Her greatest challenge is poor weather and sometimes there is a lack of proper markets.

Joyce chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it is flexible, reaches to small scale farmers and their interest rate is affordable and also client friendly. Her highest monthly expense is school fees and therefore, through the income she gets out of the loan, she will be able to cater for her children's school fees. Their livelihood will also improve.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen lives in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya with her family. She has three children, all attending school, She has been farming for over 10 years where she produces and sells eggs, milk, maize and vegetables. She enjoys farming as it provides food for her family, and it also generates income for her.
Doreen chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because she will be able to access agricultural inputs that can bring more profit to her agri-business. During the training received from the Business Development Officer, she learned that microfinance helps poor people to grow economically. Her largest family expenses are school fees and family expenses. Those expenses will be met when she uses the loan to purchase more poultry. Then she will sell more eggs and poultry and her income will increase.She has a strong desire to grow economically.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Meet Susan, who resides in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya with her family of 3 children, all of whom are school-going age. She and has practiced farming for the past 20 years; her main source of income is bananas and eggs.She enjoys farming since it brings her income from the sale of farm produce. Her biggest challenge is marketing the farm produce.

Susan chose Juhudi Kilimo for her loan because she wants to improve her farming and Juhudi invests in farmers to change their livelihoods. During the training, she learnt that microfinance institutions help the poor access finances. Her highest monthly expense is school fees. This loan will help provide food for her family and income to help fund her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase farm equipment.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a farmer who lives in Kitale, a high poultry producing area.  She is married and has five children, who all are of school-going age.  She has practiced farming for two years where her primary source of income comes from the sale of eggs, maize and beans.  She enjoys farming because of the egg collection and being able to supply her customers.  Her biggest challenge is cleaning the chicken house and attacks of poultry diseases.

Jackline chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they will help her to expand her poultry project.  She learned that Juhudi finances dairy and poultry projects.  She says that with more production of eggs, her family will have enough for consumption and selling which will bring in more money for the sustenance of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a farmer. He lives in Kitale with his wife and three children, all of whom are school-going age. Charles has undertaken farming for 4 years where his primary income sources are from the sale of eggs and crops like maize. Besides farming, Charles has a motorbike which he uses to transport people and goods in the area. This is as an extra source of income. What Charles enjoys most about farming is seeing his customers satisfied and coming back for more of his products. His major challenges are long rains which affect his crops and also dealing with pests.

Charles chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because Juhudi Kilimo listens to its clients and has good customer relationships. During the training given by the loan officers, Charles learned that by saving, he will be able to secure his future. This loan will enable him to acquire a dairy cow which will provide milk for his family and also for sale which will bring in more income for growth to his business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Phidah

texts.en:
Meet Phidah who lives in Kitale area of North Rift in Kenya with her husband and seven children most of whom are of school-going age.She is a farmer who has been at it for seven years. Her sources of income are milk, eggs and crop products. She also has a retail business and a posho mill which acts as an extra source of income.

This is her second loan with Juhudi. With the first loan she bought a dairy cow and she has really benefited from the loan given by Juhudi. Thus after repaying her first loan, she has applied for a second loan to purchase poultry to improve her poultry project and increase her income level which will help cater for the family's expenses and her children's school fees. She has developed a savings culture.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Yunes

texts.en:
Yunes is a farmer living in Kisii with her husband and 3 children. She has been farming for 5 years, and her main source of income is from selling milk, eggs, tea, maize and bananas. She enjoys farming because she gets to sell her farm produce. Her biggest challenge is the low prices she can get for her milk, thus getting little income out of it.

Yunes chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they give low income farmers loans for dairy products which will improve their living standards. During the training offered by the loan officers, she learned how to make savings. This loan will provide milk for her family's consumption and generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mourice

texts.en:
Mourice is a dairy and crop farmer. He lives in the Kitale area in the north rift of Kenya with his wife and their four children, all of whom are of school-going age. 

Mourice has been engaged in farming for four years, and he earns an income by selling milk as well as produce from his crops. He earns an additional income by transporting people and goods on his motorcycle.

He enjoys cultivating his land and preparing it for the planting season. His primary challenge at this time is that he does not have enough capital to buy more dairy cows. He chose to approach Juhudi Kilimo for a loan because they help finance, farming projects, and he wanted to be financed so that he can buy a dairy cow. He learned that the interest rate on the loans is low and that the repayment period is flexible.

This loan will lead to an increased income, which will translate into having more money to sustain the family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives and does farming in the Kitale area of Northrift, Kenya, an area known for high maize production. He is married and has four children, all of whom are of school-going age. He has been doing farming for seven years; he sells eggs and maize. Besides farming, he also has a transportation business with his motorbike. He enjoys farming because of the profits he gets after the hard work in the fields. His biggest challenge is lack of enough farming equipment and lack of enough resources to buy seeds and fertilizers.

This is his second loan. The first loan he used to purchase a piece of land where he does farming. He benefited from it and that's why he decided to apply for a second loan, to increase poultry on his farm. From the training he received,he learned how to manage his loan well and the importance of savings. This loan will help increase his income, which he will use to meet his family's needs and also help in the payment of school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka lives and farms in Kitale, a region known for high maize output. She is married and has three children, all of whom are of school age. She has been doing agriculture for five years, and she produces and sells milk and crops like maize. In farming, she loves to plant and sell maize. The greatest challenge she faces is weeds and pests.
This is Milka's second loan and therefore she chose to work with Juhudi Kilimo, as her first loan helped her increase her income,and thus she wants to build her income more by purchasing a dairy cow. During the training she received, she learned that MFIs help small scale farmers to acquire assets. This loan will help her to bring in more income and thus she will be able to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Meet Andrew, who lives and farms in Kisii, a primary area for the growth of sugar cane and bananas. He is married and has 8 children. He has been farming for 15 years and his income comes from the sale of milk, eggs, and tea. Besides farming, he has a small retail business, which is an extra source of income. He enjoys farming because of the milk he sells. His biggest challenge is that milk prices are very low.

Andrew chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer dairy loans to low income farmers. During the training, he learned how to develop a culture of savings. This loan will give his family more milk for consumption and income generation.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a farmer who lives in Kisii with her husband and five children, all of whom attend school. For the last eight years, she has worked as a farmer, earning her income by selling milk, eggs, and tea.She enjoys farming, especially producing and selling milk. Her biggest challenge is diseases affecting both crops and livestock. Jane chose to ask Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it provides financial support to small-scale farmers. During our training, she learned how to farm efficiently and effectively.This loan will allow her to generate more milk for her family's consumption and also to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives and does farming in the Kisii area of Nyanza. He is married and has seven children and has practiced farming for 15 years. His income comes from the sale of milk, eggs, tea, maize and bananas. He enjoys farming because of the sale of farm produce. His biggest challenge is getting animal feed and the transportation of his products to the market is a problem.

Samuel chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they do offer farmers dairy loans at low interest rates and they give training to their clients on agriculture. During the training, he learnt how to repay the loan effectively. This loan will provide milk for his family's consumption and also for income generation.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 22-year-old farmer living in Litein, south of the rift area. She is married and has two children. She has been farming for three years, through which she produces and sells milk and eggs. She loves farming, because of the profit she gets out of selling her farm produce. Her biggest challenge comes when there are poor climatic conditions.
Diana chose Juhudi Kilimo, because they have helped her acquire income generating assets, and she has grown economically.This will help her increase her income and cater to her family's needs.

loans.use: to construct a green house.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Meet Benard, a farmer living in the Kisii area of Nyanza, Kenya. He is married and has three children, all of whom are of school-going age.

Benard has been farming for seven years. His main source of income is from selling milk, eggs, tea, maize, and bananas. He enjoys farming very much because it is his major source of income. The challenges he faces are poor roads and lack of a market.

Benard chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they provide loans to finance income generating assets.They also offer their loans at low interest rates and are client-friendly.

This loan will benefit his family by improving their living standards. A water storage tank for his crops and livestock will help his farm to be more productive.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a farmer living in Litein area of South Rift Valley, Kenya.He is married and has three children. He has been farming for two years with his main sources of income coming from the sale of milk, eggs and tea. He enjoys dairy farming from which he benefits greatly. His biggest challenge is the poor quality dairy breeds that they get in the area.
Richard chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer reasonable interest rates. He learned that microfinance institutions help low-income earners to become economically viable.This loan will enable him to buy more poultry which will bring in more income and thus improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is widowed and has children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a coconut selling business. She sells at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to become a wholesaler in the near future. 

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase seven sacks of coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a farmer living in the Kitale area of North Rift Kenya. She is married and has seven children. Eunice has been farming for 14 years and her primary income sources are milk, eggs and maize. She also has a posho mill business. What she enjoys most in farming is the income she receives.
Eunice said that she was introduced to Juhudi Kilimo by a friend who has succeeded with the asset financing that Juhudi offers. During the training,she learned that micro finance institutions help small-scale farmers establish capital for their farming activities. With this loan, she will add more poultry to her farm and therefore increase her income. She will be able to take care of her family's needs and will also help pay school fees for her grandchildren. Her family's living standards will improve.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
